name: Hotel San Gabriel

reviews.text: Before I review the hotel, I have to mention, that our stay in Andalusia coincided with some of the worst weather this part of the world has experienced over the past 10 years. We had snow, freezing cold, rain, hail, thunderstorms, strong winds and in between a few minutes of sunshine.
reviews.title: Romantic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to agree with most of the previous reviews of this Hotel. There is nothing to complain about this hotel except on thing: Due to the cold weather the room was freezing cold. There was heater/aircon-unit on the wall, but that didn't do much good. Even though they hat radiators in our rooms, the where only turned on sometime during the evening for a couple of hours and then shut down again. When we woke up in the morning the room was ice cold. Taking a shower was no option, because the bathroom was even colder. Other than that it was a perfect stay in a great hotel, with beautiful and romantic rooms (great attention to detail), a great an quiet location, in an interesting town.
reviews.title: Romantic hotel with a personal touch
Charming Hotel
reviews.text: We truly enjoyed our stay in Hotel San Gabriel. While I wouldn't call it the best in Spain like in another review, I think that it's unbeatable in its price category (we paid 80 euros per night for a standart double without breakfast). The location is perfect: In the heart of 'La Ciudad', the oldest and nicest part of Ronda, but very quiet. We appreciated the little details which showed that the owners really care about their guests. In the wine cellar you are treated to a glas of sherry, you can enjoy movies in a lovely decorated mini-cinema, there is a free library with a wide choice of books. Unfortunately none of the staff informed us about those extras and also in the room there was no information about it. We even discovered only after 2 days that there is an elevator, as it is well disguised. Our room was quite large, very tastefully decorated, the bathroom without fault. Breakfast with good quality products but a rather limited choice. All in all very recommendable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And if you like to have a great dinner with creative Andalucian dishes and a view over the gorge then try Restaurante Santo Pola, just around the corner from the hotel. Very good recommendation from the hotel staff!
reviews.title: The best hotel in Spain!

reviews.text: Fresh, whitewashed feeling, combined w/antique looking furniture and andalusian style tiled bathroom. The bed was very nice and comfortable but only full size. Big beds are unusual in this area. Our room was a junior suite, in two levels, with a 3 steps up to the bed. It felt cozy and romantic but spacious for this area.
reviews.title: What a gem of a Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the old part of town and in a very old but tastefully decorated house, they managed to make it feel airy, yet with lots of personality and nice decor.
reviews.title: A Gem

description: This carefully restored building dates from the 18th century and lies in the most historic district of Ronda, surrounded by ancient monuments.Retaining much of its original charm, the San Gabriel still displays an attractive stone façade and the coat of arms of one of its former owners. Spend a quiet moment in the library corner or in the typically Andalusian courtyard, full of plants and a trickling fountain. Here you can start the day with the hotel’s delicious breakfast. You can also enjoy a film in the intimate cinema room, which includes red velvet seats taken from the city’s old cinema. Combined with its privileged location, the hotel facilities make this a truly authentic Spanish setting for your holiday in rural Andalusia.
